Method Detail

get

public static Controller get()
Returns:
The Controller associated with the current Thread, or if there wasn't one, a new Controller that will be associated with the current Thread. The returned Controller will have an open transaction. Code using Controller.get() MUST make sure to call release() when finished with the controller to avoid a memory leak. e.g. 
      try {
          Controller controller = Controller.get();
          // ... do some business ... or play ...
      } finally {
          Controller.release();
      }

get

public static Controller get(boolean create)
Parameters:
create - if true, and there is not already a Controller associated with this Thread, a new Controller will be created.
Returns:
The Controller associated with the current Thread with an active UserTransaction open. If there wasn't a Controller with this thread and create is true, then a new Controller will be created and associated with the current Thread. If create is false, null will be returned if there was not already a Controller associated with the current Thread. On the whole, this function guarantees to do one of four things: If create == false: - return a Controller with an open transaction that was previously created and associated with the current thread. - return null, if no code previously called get(true) If create == true: - return a Controller with an open transaction that was created as a result of this call to get(true) - throw a RuntimeException, if a new Controller could not be created, or if there was an exception thrown while starting a transaction in the new Controller
Throws:
java.lang.RuntimeException - if create is true and there is an error creating the controller Exceptions normally thrown by beginning a UserTransaction are laundered from checked exceptions to unchecked RuntimeExceptions so that code calling Controller.get() does not ALWAYS have to catch the exception. However, code using Controller.get() MUST make sure to call release() when finished with the controller to avoid a memory leak. e.g. 
      try {
          Controller controller = Controller.get();
          // ... do some business ... or play ...
      } finally {
          Controller.release();
      }

getIsolatedInstance

public static Controller getIsolatedInstance()
Returns:
a new Controller instance that is not associated with any Thread. Callers MUST call end() on the controller. This controller does not have a transaction open; it's up to the caller to manage the transaction.
Throws:
java.lang.RuntimeException - if there is an error creating the controller

release

public static void release()
Releases a Controller associated with the current thread, if there was one. release() will internally call end() on the instance associated with the current thread, if it was found.

Throws:
java.lang.RuntimeException - if there is an exception ending the UserTransaction

getUserTransaction

public javax.transaction.UserTransaction getUserTransaction()
Returns:
The CMT UserTransaction

Returns:
The underlying EntityManager

begin

public void begin()
           throws javax.transaction.NotSupportedException,
                  javax.transaction.SystemException
Begins the container managed UserTransaction and clears fields used to store problems / errors.

Throws:
javax.transaction.NotSupportedException
javax.transaction.SystemException

end

public void end()
         throws javax.transaction.SystemException,
                javax.transaction.RollbackException,
                javax.transaction.HeuristicMixedException,
                javax.transaction.HeuristicRollbackException
Ends the contatiner managed UserTransaction, committing or rolling back as necessary.

Throws:
javax.transaction.SystemException
javax.transaction.RollbackException
javax.transaction.HeuristicMixedException
javax.transaction.HeuristicRollbackException

findNaturalId

public <T> T findNaturalId(java.lang.Class<T> entityClass,
                           org.hibernate.criterion.NaturalIdentifier naturalId)
Find a single object matching criteria using a naturalId lookup with the queryByFormula cache Sample criteria include: Restrictions.naturalId().set("email",request.getRemoteUser()); See for more examples: http://www.hibernate.org/hib_docs/reference/en/html/querycriteria.html#queryByFormula-criteria-naturalid

Type Parameters:

count

public <T> int count(java.lang.Class<T> entityClass,
                     java.lang.Object... criteria)
Find the count of object matching the criteria Sample criteria include: Restrictions.eq("property", variable) Restrictions.eq("subclass.property", variable) Order.desc("property") See for more examples: http://www.hibernate.org/hib_docs/v3/api/org/hibernate/criterion/Restrictions.html

Type Parameters:
T -
Parameters:
entityClass -
criteria -
Returns:
